summary: This document is an email chain between FBI agents and an NYPD officer coordinating logistics for showing discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team at the Metropolitan Detention Center (MDC). It details scheduling, personnel availability, and the handling of digital evidence (a laptop and hard drive) for review.

persons.name: Mark
persons.context: An FBI Special Agent from the New York Field Office (SO-9) who is coordinating and volunteering to assist with showing discovery to Ghislaine Maxwell at MDC.

persons.name: Kimberly
persons.context: Referred to as 'ICkmberly' in the email, she is to be coordinated with to pick up the drive and laptop containing discovery materials for Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The accused individual in custody at MDC, for whom discovery (digital evidence on a laptop and hard drive) is to be shown to her and her defense team.

connections.description: Mark, an FBI Special Agent, is involved in the operational logistics of providing discovery to Maxwell, who is the subject of the investigation.

events.title: Scheduled Discovery Review at MDC
events.description: Planned event where FBI agents are to show digital discovery (on a laptop and hard drive) to Ghislaine Maxwell and her defense team at the Metropolitan Detention Center, scheduled from 8am to 3pm.

keyFacts: FBI agents were coordinating as late as October 14, 2020, to show discovery evidence to Ghislaine Maxwell at MDC on October 16, 2020.
The discovery materials were digital evidence stored on a laptop and an external hard drive.
The email chain reveals operational planning between FBI personnel and an NYPD officer for a legal procedure in the Maxwell investigation.
The correspondence indicates the involvement of an Assistant United States Attorney (AUSA) in coordinating the details with MDC.
Multiple FBI agents from different squads (SO-9, C-20) were involved in the logistical support for the discovery review.
